description: Academic paper graph visualizer for easier literature reviewing
README.md:
RefGraph
--------
Academic paper graph visualizer for easier literature reviewing.

### [Mockup video](http://youtu.be/mB4mI3JeCnI) ###

### Similar examples ###

- [PaperCube](http://papercube.peterbergstrom.com/) reference visualization. [Source code](https://github.com/pbergstr/PaperCube).

- [Web of Knowledge](www.webofknowledge.com) have a similar web-app.

### APIs ###

- [MIT list of APIs](http://libguides.mit.edu/apis).

- [ArXiv API](http://arxiv.org/help/api/index). A parser of mine work great but there are no references. [Here](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/arxiv-api/VSdpMz74AAY) are some instructions of how to find the references of an ArXiv article.

- [CrossRef](http://search.crossref.org/) metedata search and [API](http://search.crossref.org/help/api). For example: [http://search.crossref.org/dois?q=education&page=0&rows=3&header=true](http://search.crossref.org/dois?q=education&page=0&rows=3&header=true)

- [Mendeley API](http://apidocs.mendeley.com/) and [example](http://api.mendeley.com/oapi/documents/search/title:Education/?consumer_key=bd444525f8612f9112c38b650f0ab236052a5c15a).

- [CiteSeer](http://csxstatic.ist.psu.edu/about/data) [OAI-PMH](http://www.openarchives.org/) based on API. Used by [PaperCube](http://papercube.peterbergstrom.com/).

- [ADS 2](http://labs.adsabs.harvard.edu/adsabs/) has a promising [API](https://github.com/adsabs/adsabs-dev-api). Looks like a good starting point.
